title.content-text: 1.1.1 - Networks Supporting the Way We Live

brief.content-text:
The video presents a story of a small town in Brazil where the Internet and computers have enabled them to connect with the rest of the world and brought opportunities to people.
"Tiradentes is a very small town, with no newspaper delivery, no computers, and TV has been available for just a few years. Digital inclusion has been a breakthrough in Tiradentes history. Wireless mesh technology connected Tiradentes with the whole world. The week we went live on the Net, 158 people accessed our website." A candy store owner states, "I downloaded new recipes to increment the business." "Surveillance cameras help monitor security of historical buildings. At the same time, tourists anywhere will be able to access our site and see images of the city online. Who would imagine something like this. Tiradentes is a small, historical tourist town. It will continue to be, but now with digital inclusion, medical exams are sent to specialists over the Net, significantly reducing the need for people to commute to hospitals in larger cities. Due to the excitement of using computers to browse the Net, children have renewed interest in learning to read and write. It changed our lives. It changed everything!"
